title: Our greetings
historical_context: This article reflects the hacker culture of the late 1990s, showcasing the camaraderie and informal communication styles prevalent in IRC channels and hacker communities.
target_audience: Hackers, phreakers, and members of the hacker community interested in social dynamics and culture.
short_summary: A light-hearted collection of greetings to various individuals in the hacker community, showcasing the personal connections and humor shared among members.
summary:
In this article, Mister Sandman extends a series of playful and humorous greetings to various members of the hacker community. The greetings reflect a sense of camaraderie and shared experiences among hackers, with references to inside jokes, personal anecdotes, and cultural touchstones that resonate within the community. The tone is informal and friendly, emphasizing the social aspect of hacking culture, particularly through platforms like IRC where these interactions often take place.

The greetings serve not only as a way to acknowledge friends and peers but also as a snapshot of the relationships and dynamics within the hacker scene at the time. The article captures the essence of a tight-knit community, where humor and personal connections are valued as much as technical prowess. This piece is a reminder of the human side of hacking, illustrating how personal relationships can thrive even in a subculture often characterized by anonymity and technical jargon.
